title: Ruqqus already feels more like old Reddit than current Reddit does

body: 1 million times this man. The fact that people are adult enough to ignore the things they don't like while not having to go find mommy and daddy to protect their sensitive eyes and ears. Man, the admin situation is way out of control over there. I don't even care about regular censorship on a board or whatever that specifies that you can't act a certain way, but the general culture is such that the whole site is a hivemind. It's kind of a cross between a weird authoritarian victorian sensibility and some kind of Maoist cult.
body_html: 1 million times this man. The fact that people are adult enough to ignore the things they don't like while not having to go find mommy and daddy to protect their sensitive eyes and ears. I don't even care about regular censorship on a board or whatever that specifies that you can't act a certain way, but the general culture is such that the whole site is a hivemind. It's kind of a cross between a weird authoritarian victorian sensibility and some kind of Maoist cult.

body:
>There is no sense of community there anymore.

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23173018&p=2

From HN user trasmatta

>It's weird how the sense is community that existed on forums just doesn't exist on Reddit. You just don't have the same connection to the other posters that you would on tight knit forums. You might as well not even have usernames.
It's a bit different on smaller, more focused subreddits, but not by much.
I used to think that Reddit was a better place to be than Twitter or Facebook, but now I'm not so sure. I've definitely had a harder time cutting it out of my life than those other two, even though I think it's had a pretty bad effect on my mental health.
body_html:
There is no sense of community there anymore.

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23173018&p=2

From HN user trasmatta

It's weird how the sense is community that existed on forums just doesn't exist on Reddit. You just don't have the same connection to the other posters that you would on tight knit forums. You might as well not even have usernames. It's a bit different on smaller, more focused subreddits, but not by much. I used to think that Reddit was a better place to be than Twitter or Facebook, but now I'm not so sure. I've definitely had a harder time cutting it out of my life than those other two, even though I think it's had a pretty bad effect on my mental health.

post.title: Ruqqus already feels more like old Reddit than current Reddit does

body:
It's going to take some diligence on the part of the Ruqqus pioneers to get things rolling, and that means effort. What was so appealing to me as an ex-Digger on Reddit wasn't just the fresh free-form expression, but the niche communities there I discovered that had similar interests. Things like obscure sports teams, or boardgaming. Those communities were small but very active, and provided fresh reading material every day. This kept me coming back.

Things like that are completely organic and need to be grown, so it's difficult to just transplant that kind of community somewhere else. It takes tons of effort on the users' part, in the form of new submissions.

This might seem counter-productive, so call me out on it if I'm wrong here, but... I wonder if it'd be possible to somehow bot/script some method of duplicating a specific subreddit's top daily posts (the actual links and submission text) then copying them to the relevant Ruqqus guild? Maybe somehow hidden, awaiting manual approval so a GM can filter the political garbage? For modest Reddit communities that are not completely politically overrun, this would allow Redditors to transplant themselves to Ruqqus completely without feeling forced to use both. For example, I see Ruqqus has a boardgaming guild, but it's sorely lacking. It just needs an injection of content.

Mirroring would provide the much needed adrenaline boost of submissions, but with fresh context around the discussion of each particular post -- and without the delicate eggshell tippy-toe game of comments/hivemind surrounding it.
body_html:
It's going to take some diligence on the part of the Ruqqus pioneers to get things rolling, and that means effort. What was so appealing to me as an ex-Digger on Reddit wasn't just the fresh free-form expression, but the niche communities there I discovered that had similar interests. Things like obscure sports teams, or boardgaming. Those communities were small but very active, and provided fresh reading material every day. This kept me coming back.

Things like that are completely organic and need to be grown, so it's difficult to just transplant that kind of community somewhere else. It takes tons of effort on the users' part, in the form of new submissions.

This might seem counter-productive, so call me out on it if I'm wrong here, but... I wonder if it'd be possible to somehow bot/script some method of duplicating a specific subreddit's top daily posts (the actual links and submission text) then copying them to the relevant Ruqqus guild? Maybe somehow hidden, awaiting manual approval so a GM can filter the political garbage? For modest Reddit communities that are not completely politically overrun, this would allow Redditors to transplant themselves to Ruqqus completely without feeling forced to use both. For example, I see Ruqqus has a boardgaming guild, but it's sorely lacking. It just needs an injection of content.

Mirroring would provide the much needed adrenaline boost of submissions, but with fresh context around the discussion of each particular post -- and without the delicate eggshell tippy-toe game of comments/hivemind surrounding it.

body:
Hey I have a bot that rips content from reddit. Right now it mainly reposts memes since it doesn't require participation from OP. If you want to add a subreddit to the meme/image rotation let me know. RIght now it operates on memes, aww, meirl, historymemes, and politicalcompassmemes.

As for the smaller niche subreddits which are centered around discussion it would be more difficult. I might be able to do something where I crosspost text posts and their replies so that the boardgaming guild could interact with the boardgaming subreddit using my bot as a sort of proxy. This would be a feature for when ruqqus finishes writing their API since my bot cannot consistently write comments

post.title: Ruqqus already feels more like old Reddit than current Reddit does

body: It's pretty important to remember that small communities are easier to be a part of. Reddit got too big and as a result it turned into drive by interactions. As soon as votes become clout it's all over. That being said, I feel really welcome here and that's unusual on the internet these days. Good work everyone!
body_html: It's pretty important to remember that small communities are easier to be a part of. Reddit got too big and as a result it turned into drive by interactions. As soon as votes become clout it's all over. That being said, I feel really welcome here and that's unusual on the internet these days. Good work everyone!

post.title: Ruqqus already feels more like old Reddit than current Reddit does

body:
Nice to be with you guys, this place does seem welcoming. I miss that feeling that you had on Internet boards in the 2000's. Despite the 'wild west' it was it was genuinely a more enjoyable experience than when the modern day 'mainstream' internet. 

It isn't just reddit though, all the big websites just feel so contrived and fake right now, it's hard to get a grasp on it. This week seems to have illustrated it all at once. A place like this just feels absolutely pure in comparison.
body_html:
Nice to be with you guys, this place does seem welcoming. I miss that feeling that you had on Internet boards in the 2000's. Despite the 'wild west' it was it was genuinely a more enjoyable experience than when the modern day 'mainstream' internet.

It isn't just reddit though, all the big websites just feel so contrived and fake right now, it's hard to get a grasp on it. This week seems to have illustrated it all at once. A place like this just feels absolutely pure in comparison.

body:
They really can't do much if Ruqqus sticks with its principles of free speech. Totalitarian "ideas" only thrive in an artificial environment full of censorship such as Reddit, Twitter, etc. - their "safe spaces". These people also don't have the willpower to actually fight for what they believe, they just try to call mommy/daddy/admins/mods to ban wrongthinkers.

Their last resort would probably be going full AHS and trying to post CP here, but I don't see this working either since Ruqqus has active admins who seem to know what they're doing.

parent.body:
It's going to take some diligence on the part of the Ruqqus pioneers to get things rolling, and that means effort. What was so appealing to me as an ex-Digger on Reddit wasn't just the fresh free-form expression, but the niche communities there I discovered that had similar interests. Things like obscure sports teams, or boardgaming. Those communities were small but very active, and provided fresh reading material every day. This kept me coming back.

Things like that are completely organic and need to be grown, so it's difficult to just transplant that kind of community somewhere else. It takes tons of effort on the users' part, in the form of new submissions.

This might seem counter-productive, so call me out on it if I'm wrong here, but... I wonder if it'd be possible to somehow bot/script some method of duplicating a specific subreddit's top daily posts (the actual links and submission text) then copying them to the relevant Ruqqus guild? Maybe somehow hidden, awaiting manual approval so a GM can filter the political garbage? For modest Reddit communities that are not completely politically overrun, this would allow Redditors to transplant themselves to Ruqqus completely without feeling forced to use both. For example, I see Ruqqus has a boardgaming guild, but it's sorely lacking. It just needs an injection of content.

Mirroring would provide the much needed adrenaline boost of submissions, but with fresh context around the discussion of each particular post -- and without the delicate eggshell tippy-toe game of comments/hivemind surrounding it.
parent.body_html:
It's going to take some diligence on the part of the Ruqqus pioneers to get things rolling, and that means effort. What was so appealing to me as an ex-Digger on Reddit wasn't just the fresh free-form expression, but the niche communities there I discovered that had similar interests. Things like obscure sports teams, or boardgaming. Those communities were small but very active, and provided fresh reading material every day. This kept me coming back.

Things like that are completely organic and need to be grown, so it's difficult to just transplant that kind of community somewhere else. It takes tons of effort on the users' part, in the form of new submissions.

This might seem counter-productive, so call me out on it if I'm wrong here, but... I wonder if it'd be possible to somehow bot/script some method of duplicating a specific subreddit's top daily posts (the actual links and submission text) then copying them to the relevant Ruqqus guild? Maybe somehow hidden, awaiting manual approval so a GM can filter the political garbage? For modest Reddit communities that are not completely politically overrun, this would allow Redditors to transplant themselves to Ruqqus completely without feeling forced to use both. For example, I see Ruqqus has a boardgaming guild, but it's sorely lacking. It just needs an injection of content.

Mirroring would provide the much needed adrenaline boost of submissions, but with fresh context around the discussion of each particular post -- and without the delicate eggshell tippy-toe game of comments/hivemind surrounding it.

parent.body:
Hey I have a bot that rips content from reddit. Right now it mainly reposts memes since it doesn't require participation from OP. If you want to add a subreddit to the meme/image rotation let me know. RIght now it operates on memes, aww, meirl, historymemes, and politicalcompassmemes.

As for the smaller niche subreddits which are centered around discussion it would be more difficult. I might be able to do something where I crosspost text posts and their replies so that the boardgaming guild could interact with the boardgaming subreddit using my bot as a sort of proxy. This would be a feature for when ruqqus finishes writing their API since my bot cannot consistently write comments
